text:
<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased API Failure Rates>
We are currently investigating increased error rates to Elastic Beanstalk APIs in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Create Times and Cluster Unavailability>
We are investigating increased database create times and cluster unavailability for Amazon Aurora in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Create Times and Cluster Unavailability>
We can confirm increased database create times and cluster unavailability for Amazon Aurora in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. We have identified the root cause and continue to work toward resolution.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased API Failure Rates>
We can confirm increased error rates for the Elastic Beanstalk APIs in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. We have identified the root cause and continue to work toward resolution.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased API Failure Rates>
Between 12:39 PM and 2:12 PM PST we experienced elevated error rates in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Create Times and Cluster Unavailability>
We have resolved the issue resulting in increased database create times, and continue to work toward full resolution on Amazon Aurora Cluster Availability.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Create Times and Cluster Unavailability>
We are beginning to see recovery for some Amazon Aurora Clusters and continue to work toward full resolution.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Create Times and Cluster Unavailability>
We wanted to provide an update for Amazon Aurora in the CA-CENTRAL-1 Region that we previously communicated to affected customers on their Personal Health Dashboards. Between 11:43 AM and 4:48 PM PST we experienced increased database create times and cluster unavailability for a small number of Amazon Aurora instances in the CA-CENTRAL-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
